reviews.review_msg: The optional textbook he recommends in the syllabus teaches you better than his lectures.

horrible prof. lectures are completely useless, confuses himself. fill in the blank (incomplete) slides posted. exam information (concrete, such as question format/layout of the exam) given only 24hrs before the exam. does not provide nearly enough practice for what is for most students the first ochem class they have ever taken. grades crazy harsh

Doesn't respond to emails, teaches confusingly, and at times doesn't even know the answers to the questions he's demonstrating. He comes in late fairly often, but doesn't make up the time. 
The slides he puts online have sections missing, so you have to come to class or get the missing parts from a friend.
You'll need to teach yourself this course.

Explains concepts well in detail. I Had exams clashing with this class, but Khaled always figured something out. He stayed after class to help understand topics, super chill dude. Final is very similar to his practice exam. Midterm is similar to loncapas. Only tough part was the quizzes.
there was alot to remember with any chem class but his teaching was pretty accurate was told what to know and such with simple examples the final was a bit harder but other wise was chill

if you want to hold onto your dignity, don't take this class. the lack of examples is astounding. the lack of explanations is even worse. he will give you basic questions in class/tutorial, but then the tests are nothing like that. terrible class average. he only grades you on 4 things, the final is essentially half your grade. don't recommend lol.

OChem is a difficult course regardless of the professor. Khaled was good in the sense that his lectures were comprehensive and his exams related to the lectures. Office hours are full because he goes into depth answering questions. Nothing is confusing about having him as a prof and makes Organic Chemistry seem simpler than it is.

he doesn't really teach much because its a lab but the lab overall is difficult and long but manageable. do all the pre lab work and read through the manual to become familiar with the procedure and pray you get lab partners that aren't stupid

his lectures were extremely boring, no matter how hard I tried I could not pay attention. he's not very engaging and does very few to no examples in class. the midterm was fair but the final was a little harder. quizzes were also rough and were difficult to do well on. he's friendly and wants you to do well, but not the best at teaching
he doesnt care at all. goes through stuff really fast, barely explains, and during lab he is gone for more than 90% of the time. had to self teach almost all the material

The style of his teaching made it difficult. He doesn't explain concepts in detail like other chem professors I had and his accent can make it a bit hard for me to understand. He goes very quickly in lectures so I have to teach myself. The exam happened very quickly as well.
Horrible
He is one of my favorite professors. He explains the concepts very well. Totally recommended
Khaled is one of the best chem profs you can get - if you get the chance to take a class with him, take it!!!
He is bad

Chem 283 Summer 2022 semester. Do yourself a favour and NEVER take a course with this prof EVER in your life. He is super difficult to understand due to his accent and his lectures are extremely dry. Also, he expects you to know +10-20 mechanisms that he only spends 30 secs in class, on the exams, with type of questions you have never seen before.

this profs lectures drags on and yet talks so little of what you actually need for the exams. you learn more by studying using youtube videos and from TAs during tutorial. expects u to know mechanisms that he barely even teaches
CHEM 280 is HARD ASF. However this prof does go into detail about everything that you need to know. He rambles on sometimes in lec BUT he cover everything you need to know.
Class was hard af but was scaled very nicely. Prof was alright lectures were boring and hard to understand.
lectures were very helpful but sometimes dragged on, final was WAY harder than the midterm lol

Dr. Arafeh is very kind and has really detailed, consistent lectures. He gives sufficient review sessions and is accessible outside of class. The course material itself can be hard, but Dr. Arafeh is definitely passionate about what he teaches. Exams are graded fairly.

This class is very dry, and Dr. Arafeh did not do much to help that out. His lecture slides were bland, and he didn't speak very clearly on things, often making mistakes in what he was describing or getting things switched around. The exams were fair with a good amount of time allotted, and marking was also quite reasonable.

good prof and very passionate about chemistry. lectures are content heavy and long but that's how the material is. good and clear explanations about every topic. fair exams are very similar to tutorial worksheets. the content is very difficult which makes getting a good grade difficult.

Prof. Arafeh was alright. The course itself was very heavy and he did his best to explain all of it, however some details were left to be covered in tutorials by TAs. Midterm was fair. Final exam was very challenging. Overall, I would take another course with him if I had to but I wouldnt seek him out as a professor.

Professor Khaled was alright. The course is difficult, and he does try to explain the material. However he contradicts himself from time to time, saying that we don't need to worry about concepts but then changes his mind later on. He also doesn't go over practice questions during lectures, leading to the TAs teaching more than him during tutorial.
The prof is good at teaching and is very clear. Lectures are long because he explains in detail. Exams are also fair. The content of the course is difficult, but the prof makes its tolerable.

Don't get me wrong this is a tough course but if you're going to take it this is the guy to take it with. Very passionate about the material, lecture videos are somewhat long but that's just because he tries to explain the concept as much as possible in each class. I hate chem but I would definitely take another class with him if I could.

I will not recommend taking this class with this prof. He goes through concepts fast, and doesn't explain the concepts of harder questions that are in tutorial pdfs. TAs would give us the answers, however, the details steps weren't taught in lectures which makes this course much harder than it is to study for.

A solid prof. Was super scared of ochem online as my previous general chemistry courses were all online and tough. But his midterms and quizzes are very straightforward and allowed me to show my understanding way better than those loncapa midterms i took in chem 120 and 122 online. The tutorial worksheets are super helpful

Took CHEM280 with professor Arafeh online where he used pre-recorded lectures from previous semesters. Lectures were dry and not well organized with the material in tutorial problem sets not related to his lectures. Most of the content was learned through tutorial sessions.

I'm a chem major and khaled has been my fav prof i've had at sfu. He really cares about his students and goes through very detailed examples in lectures. His lectures are super long but any intro org chem course will be like this. the exams are rlly similar to the tutorial worksheets so make sure you do those every week.

Really good prod, idk why I got swayed by inaccurate reviews before taking the course. There's a lot of course material to go over, but if you stay on track, you can manage to do well. PRACTICE the tutorial worksheets until you can understand them alone.... The exams are literally like tutorials but in parts mostly. He's clear about expectations

Solid prof. Got an 87% on the midterm because he taught very clearly even though the material itself is actually really difficult. Very accessible on piazza to ask questions and seems like he actually cares about the performance of his students.

I did terribly in general chemistry, so I was afraid of taking ochem. I did really well in this course though; 81% on the 57% average midterm . 96% on quizzes etc. My point is, Khaled was great at teaching new concepts. He's straight forward with questions (nothing new in exams), and clear at explaining. If you put in the work, you'll do great!
Explains concepts clearly while online. Difficult work, but fair for the course.

Previously failed ochem before at langara but took it again and this prof does a really thorough job with explaining concepts. Its a hard course no matter what but the practice and writing out everything really helps. Khaled is also patient with questions, would take him again if I could.

Dr. Arafeh is probably the best professor you could get for OChem. The course itself is really difficult and the material is really dry, but he is very passionate teaching it and a lovely person overall. If you need to take this course, he is a great prof! I definitely recommend taking it with him.

Class is brutal due to the amount of content so it can be exhausting but the prof recognizes that and is willing to help students instead of rambling during the already painfully long lectures. Very easy to lose marks on the exams since its all written but he directly tells you what will be on the exam during lectures.
Khaled was great at explaining concepts that seem really daunting at first. Problem sets and tutorials are very very helpful for exam prep. Midterms and final exams were extremely fair.

Khaled was a very nice instructor, and made chemistry one of my favourite classes at the time. His lectures were easy going. Exams are very fair and as long as you study hard, you should be able to get a good grade.
Great prof, the only thing is that there are a lot of hidden part marks in the exams.
good prof

Dr. Arafeh was a great professor for CHEM280 online. I'm not sure why his ratings are so low - the content can be very dry, yes and he has a 3-hour lecture per week but that's the norm for most classes. His tests are very fair and based on tutorial problem sets - nice guy, patient when explaining questions. I would def take another course with him.

I really enjoyed having Dr. Arafeh as my Ochem prof. His lectures were long, but very detailed. His midterms have been very fair so far, as long as you do all the tutorial problem sets you will do good on midterm exams. A very caring and passionate professor of organic chemistry. Would take Ochem 282 with him.

Dr Arafeh seems really interested in what he's teaching and provided a great introduction to organic chemistry! He is super nice and helpful- his lectures are quite long but I get that he has to cover a lot of content. It would be a lot better if it were broken down into 3 one hour long videos instead of 2 longer ones though.

Not great, yes he's enthusiastic about organic chem but lectures were a battle to get through each week, very long and dry. Exams were way too complicated, simple questions were worded horribly, and marks taken off often.
The instructor himself thought every concept extremly well making the use of a textbook completly unnecessary and always answered or monitored questions students asked on the given platforms.

Ochem overall is a difficult course but prof tries his best to be engaging and concise as possible. He takes his time to explain concepts (that's why his lectures are unnecessarily long) but put him on 2.20x and you'll be fine.

This prof is really good with explaining concepts but to do good in this course stay up to date with lectures and homework. Practice, practice and practice to get the mark you want and ask for help when needed because the prof and tas are very helpful and understanding.

Prof teaches fine. He's nice and seems like he wants to get us excited about chem. But the class just drains the crap out of you mostly cause the lectures are long and the content is heavy. And I think prof could explain some things much more clearly.
Almost more than 3 hours of lecture - I died.

exams were not that hard. he is ok at explaining things. you need to do tutorials and practice problems to do well. he scales the course so u will do ok. he really cares about his students and the course. content is just SUPER dry

Organic chemistry is never easy and on top of lengthy lectures it's necessary to brush up on your knowledge with outside sources like youtube. The way to do well on his exams is lots of practice problems, understanding concepts, and keeping up with tutorials and lectures. The exams are straightforward and if you work hard, you'll do fine.

His lectures were pretty lengthy so I watched all of them at double speed but pretty good lectures overall! I found the exams to be graded quite hard but the class is overall enjoyable and you can tell hes very passionate about the material. You def need to attend all the tutorials and pay attention!

He makes a tough class enjoyable. His lectures are on the longer side but at 2 hours a couple times a week, it is not too bad. The length is usually necessary to cover the content. Doing the tutorial problems is a MUST and they give a good idea of what to expect for the class. Overall made Ochemistry less scary than anticipated.

Lectures were waaaay longer than they needed to be. The lecture length average was about 1 hr 30 min to 1 hr 50 min TWICE a week. No other resources for practice and not much examples were given/explained besides tutorial.
The lectures literally DRAIN you. But if you miss a detail - there goes your mark. Both midterms are FULLY written and partial marks are scarcely given. He's a nice guy but this is just painful

Lectures can be a bit long, but if you watch them and do the practice set you'll know everything you need to know for the tests. OChem typically aint easy but with him its been not too bad at all, would take it again with him the guys a beauty.

He explains the lectures really well to make sure anyone can understand them. Your grade is primarily based on the exams. All exams are closed book and written. The course is difficult but I think he is the best prof to take it with. The lectures are 1-2 hours long but he explains pretty slow so watch in 2x speed and it shouldn't take too long.

This class isn't going to be easy no matter the prof you take it with, but Khaled does care about his students success and is passionate about the material. The lectures are long but helpful and watching on 1.3X speed makes it easier. Watching lectures isn't enough, to do well in this course you need to PRACTICE!!! Every week practice the material

Dr. Arafeh is one of the best profs at SFU. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. He gives hints during lectures as to what he will test us on and what we need to know. He is very helpful. His lectures may be a little long but they are enjoyable to watch. Would recommend him for any Chemistry course!
All you get is 2h++ video lectures, and a tutorial that introduces new types of problems which are unexplained. 3 tests in total including the final and no other assessments.

he could easily cut lecture time in half if he stopped rambling about irrelevant information and was just straight to the point. his lectures heavily exceed the appropriate lecture time- each lecture video is almost up to 2 hours long despite given very little information about the course (with poor explanations).

This class is content-heavy and he said lectures will be around 3 hours per week, but it regularly exceeds that. While he says that you need to practice a lot, he doesn't give any resources besides a worksheet that is due weekly, and you have to find your own materials, which shouldn't be the case. Also, his notes are copy-pasted from the textbook.
His notes are terrible. Ripped straight out of the textbook. His recorded lectures are essentially him rambling for 2 hours and vaguely annotating the lecture slides.

Ochem is a very hard class but also this prof is a very strict marker. There are so many cases where you could give half marks but he makes a point to say "you must have the full answer or you will get 0". The first midterm's average was 54% if that gives an idea. However, in his lectures he gives lot of encouragement (although not outside class)

hands down one of the worst professors I have had, posts unbelievably long lectures, not accessible and just not good at explaining things; lectures are supposed to be 150 minutes a week but he posts over 200 minutes worth of lectures, tutorials are rushed and if you can take the class with someone else do so

Definitely not the best professor at SFU. Taking CHEM 280 with him which is organic chemistry (only theory, can't do lab online) and he is very inaccessible. He doesn't really care if you have doubts to ask, and he specifically said not to ask him any chemistry questions and to contact only in case of emergencies. Doesn't care about his students.
great prof, chem 281 is not an easy class but this prof does an excellent job teaching the material. do practice problems!

Khalid skips over most in-depth explanations and over simplifies topics, however leaves most difficult concepts to teach two days before the midterm. His lecture notes are taken right out of Bruice Organic Textbook and his slides have no context, reading the textbook and doing the practice questions is more helpful than showing up for class.

Not an easy course, but still understandable and interesting to learn thanks to Dr. Arafeh's hard work and clear explanation. I was worried when the course became online because of the panademic situation but Dr. Arafeh makes the transition to online system smooth and easy.

He "taught" 4 chapters in 4 weeks. He covered 1 entire chapter in a 50 minute lecture 4 days before a midterm and told us that ALL of it is going to be covered on that midterm. Get ready to spend hours teaching yourself the entire course because you're definitely not going to learn anything from a professor who spends 10 seconds on one slide.
The course is quite hard and time consuming but khaled is good at explaining procedures thoroughly and makes sure everyone is on the same page
